   20: -module(logger_simple_h_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: -compile(export_all).
   23: 
   24: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   25: -include_lib("kernel/include/logger.hrl").
   26: -include_lib("kernel/src/logger_internal.hrl").
   27: 
   28: -import(logger_test_lib, [setup/2, log/3, sync_and_read/3]).
   29: 
   30: -define(check_no_log,[] = test_server:messages_get()).
   31: -define(check(Expected),
   32:         receive {log,Expected} ->
   33:                 [] = test_server:messages_get()
   34:         after 1000 ->
   35:                 ct:fail({report_not_received,
   36:                          {line,?LINE},
   37:                          {expected,Expected},
   38:                          {got,test_server:messages_get()}})
   39:         end).
   40: 
   41: -define(str,"Log from "++atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME)++
   42:             ":"++integer_to_list(?LINE)).
   43: -define(map_rep,#{function=>?FUNCTION_NAME, line=>?LINE}).
   44: -define(keyval_rep,[{function,?FUNCTION_NAME}, {line,?LINE}]).
   45: 
   46: suite() ->
   47:     [{timetrap,{seconds,30}}].
   48: 
   49: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   50:     Hs0 = logger:get_handler_config(),
   51:     Hs = lists:keydelete(cth_log_redirect,1,Hs0),
   52:     [ok = logger:remove_handler(Id) || {Id,_,_} <- Hs],
   53:     Env = [{App,Key,application:get_env(App,Key)} ||
   54:               {App,Key} <- [{kernel,logger_level}]],
   55:     [{env,Env},{logger,Hs}|Config].
   56: 
   57: end_per_suite(Config) ->
   58:     [application:set_env(App,Key,Val) || {App,Key,Val} <- ?config(env,Config)],
   59:     Hs = ?config(logger,Config),
   60:     [ok = logger:add_handler(Id,Mod,C) || {Id,Mod,C} <- Hs],
   61:     ok.
   62: 
   63: init_per_group(_Group, Config) ->
   64:     Config.
   65: 
   66: end_per_group(_Group, _Config) ->
   67:     ok.
   68: 
   69: init_per_testcase(_TestCase, Config) ->
   70:     Config.
   71: 
   72: end_per_testcase(Case, Config) ->
   73:     try apply(?MODULE,Case,[cleanup,Config])
   74:     catch error:undef -> ok
   75:     end,
   76:     ok.
   77: 
   78: groups() ->
   79:     [].
   80: 
   81: all() -> 
   82:     [start_stop,
   83:      start_crash,
   84:      replace_default,
   85:      replace_file,
   86:      replace_disk_log
   87:     ].
   88: 
   89: start_stop(_Config) ->
   90:     undefined = whereis(logger_simple_h),
   91:     register(logger_simple_h,self()),
   92:     {error,_} = logger:add_handler(simple,
   93:                                    logger_simple_h,
   94:                                    #{filter_default=>log}),    
   95:     unregister(logger_simple_h),
   96:     ok = logger:add_handler(simple,logger_simple_h,#{filter_default=>log}),
   97:     Pid = whereis(logger_simple_h),
   98:     true = is_pid(Pid),
   99:     ok = logger:remove_handler(simple),
  100:     false = is_pid(whereis(logger_simple_h)),
  101:     ok.
  102: start_stop(cleanup,_Config) ->
  103:     logger:remove_handler(simple).
  104: 
  105: %% Test that the simple logger works during startup crash
  106: start_crash(_Config) ->
  107: 
  108:     Output = os:cmd(ct:get_progname() ++ " -user baduser"),
  109:     ErrorOutput = re:replace(unicode:characters_to_binary(Output),"\r\n","\n",[global]),
  110:     ct:log("~ts",[ErrorOutput]),
  111:     {match,[_]} = re:run(ErrorOutput,"(^=SUPERVISOR REPORT====| supervisor_report *\n)",[global,multiline]),
  112:     {match,[_, _]} = re:run(ErrorOutput," crash_report *\n",[global]),
  113:     {match,[_]} = re:run(ErrorOutput," std_info *\n",[global]),
  114:     {match,[[CD]]} = re:run(ErrorOutput,"\nCrash dump is being written to: (.*)\\.\\.\\.done",
  115:                             [{capture, all_but_first, binary}, global]),
  116:     ok = file:delete(CD),
  117:     ok.
  118: 
  119: 
  120: %% This testcase just tests that it does not crash, the default handler prints
  121: %% to stdout which we cannot read from in a detached slave.
  122: replace_default(Config) ->
  123: 
  124:     {ok, _, Peer, Node} = logger_test_lib:setup(Config, [{logger, [{handler, default, undefined}]}]),
  125:     log(Node, emergency, [?str]),
  126:     log(Node, alert, [?str,[]]),
  127:     log(Node, error, [?map_rep]),
  128:     log(Node, info, [?keyval_rep]),
  129:     log(Node, info, [?keyval_rep++[not_key_val]]),
  130:     rpc:call(Node, error_logger, error_report, [some_type,?map_rep]),
  131:     rpc:call(Node, error_logger, warning_report, ["some_type",?map_rep]),
  132:     log(Node, critical, [?str,[?keyval_rep]]),
  133:     log(Node, notice, [["fake",string,"line:",?LINE]]),
  134: 
  135:     ok = rpc:call(Node, logger, add_handlers, [kernel]),
  136: 
  137:     ok = peer:stop(Peer).
  138: 
  139: replace_file(Config) ->
  140: 
  141:     {ok, _, Peer, Node} = logger_test_lib:setup(Config, [{logger, [{handler, default, undefined}]}]),
  142:     log(Node, emergency, [M1=?str]),
  143:     log(Node, alert, [M2=?str,[]]),
  144:     log(Node, error, [?map_rep]),
  145:     log(Node, warning, [?keyval_rep]),
  146:     log(Node, warning, [?keyval_rep++[not_key_val]]),
  147:     log(Node, critical, [?str,[?keyval_rep]]),
  148:     log(Node, notice, [["fake",string,"line:",?LINE]]),
  149: 
  150:     File = filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
  151:                          atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME)++".log"),
  152: 
  153:     ok = rpc:call(Node, logger, add_handlers,
  154:                   [[{handler, default, logger_std_h,
  155:                      #{ config => #{ type => {file, File} },
  156:                         formatter => {?DEFAULT_FORMATTER,?DEFAULT_FORMAT_CONFIG}}}]]),
  157: 
  158:     {ok,Bin} = sync_and_read(Node, file, File),
  159:     Lines = [unicode:characters_to_list(L) ||
  160:                 L <- binary:split(Bin,<<"\n">>,[global,trim])],
  161:     ["=EMERGENCY REPORT===="++_,
  162:      M1,
  163:      "=ALERT REPORT===="++_,
  164:      M2,
  165:      "=ERROR REPORT===="++_,
  166:      _,
  167:      _,
  168:      "=WARNING REPORT===="++_,
  169:      _,
  170:      _,
  171:      "=WARNING REPORT===="++_,
  172:      _,
  173:      _,
  174:      _,
  175:      "=CRITICAL REPORT===="++_,
  176:      _,
  177:      _,
  178:      "=NOTICE REPORT===="++_,
  179:      _
  180:     ] = Lines,
  181:     ok = peer:stop(Peer).
  182: 
  183: replace_disk_log(Config) ->
  184: 
  185:     {ok, _, Peer, Node} = logger_test_lib:setup(Config, [{logger, [{handler, default, undefined}]}]),
  186:     log(Node, emergency, [M1=?str]),
  187:     log(Node, alert, [M2=?str,[]]),
  188:     log(Node, error, [?map_rep]),
  189:     log(Node, warning, [?keyval_rep]),
  190:     log(Node, warning, [?keyval_rep++[not_key_val]]),
  191:     log(Node, critical, [?str,[?keyval_rep]]),
  192:     log(Node, notice, [["fake",string,"line:",?LINE]]),
  193: 
  194:     File = filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
  195:                          atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME)++".log"),
  196: 
  197:     ok = rpc:call(Node, logger, add_handlers,
  198:                   [[{handler, default, logger_disk_log_h,
  199:                      #{ config => #{ file => File },
  200:                         formatter => {?DEFAULT_FORMATTER,?DEFAULT_FORMAT_CONFIG}}}]]),
  201:     {ok,Bin} = sync_and_read(Node, disk_log, File),
  202:     Lines = [unicode:characters_to_list(L) ||
  203:                 L <- binary:split(Bin,<<"\n">>,[global,trim])],
  204:     ["=EMERGENCY REPORT===="++_,
  205:      M1,
  206:      "=ALERT REPORT===="++_,
  207:      M2,
  208:      "=ERROR REPORT===="++_,
  209:      _,
  210:      _,
  211:      "=WARNING REPORT===="++_,
  212:      _,
  213:      _,
  214:      "=WARNING REPORT===="++_,
  215:      _,
  216:      _,
  217:      _,
  218:      "=CRITICAL REPORT===="++_,
  219:      _,
  220:      _,
  221:      "=NOTICE REPORT===="++_,
  222:      _
  223:     ] = Lines,
  224:     ok = peer:stop(Peer).
